title: Dragon-scaled armor
data:
**Dragon-scaled armor** is a set of items originally proposed by dtsund and designed as a replacement and re-balancing of [dragon scale mail](/wiki/Dragon_scale_mail "Dragon scale mail"). Occasionally known as **dtsund-DSM**, various forms of dragon-scaled armor have appeared in several [variants](/wiki/Variants "Variants") of *[NetHack](/wiki/NetHack "NetHack")*: The proposal was first implemented into [NetHack Fourk](/wiki/NetHack_Fourk "NetHack Fourk"), and has seen further usage in [xNetHack](/wiki/XNetHack "XNetHack"), [EvilHack](/wiki/EvilHack "EvilHack"), and [Hack'EM](/wiki/Hack%27EM "Hack'EM"), each with varying minor details about how the new process works. All four variants add secondary effects to most or all colors of dragon-scaled armor, which are also documented here.

[ ]

## Contents

- [1 Description](#Description)

- [2 Implementation by variant](#Implementation_by_variant)

  - [2.1 NetHack Fourk](#NetHack_Fourk)
  - [2.2 xNetHack](#xNetHack)
  - [2.3 EvilHack](#EvilHack)
  - [2.4 Hack'EM](#Hack.27EM)

## Description

Across all variants, [dragon scales](/wiki/Dragon_scales "Dragon scales") occupy the [cloak](/wiki/Cloak "Cloak") slot rather than the [body armor](/wiki/Body_armor "Body armor") slot, and reading a [scroll of enchant armor](/wiki/Scroll_of_enchant_armor "Scroll of enchant armor") will always cause worn dragon scales to meld into the [hero](/wiki/Hero "Hero")'s currently-worn set of body armor, adding the conferred extrinsic [properties](/wiki/Properties "Properties") of the dragon scales to that armor. If the hero is wearing dragon scales but no body armor, the dragon scales will instead meld into their skin, [polymorphing](/wiki/Polymorph "Polymorph") them into a [dragon](/wiki/Dragon "Dragon") of the same color - as in *NetHack*, the scales are preserved upon the hero returning to normal form.

Directly [wishing](/wiki/Wishing "Wishing") for dragon-scaled armor does not work, requiring the player to craft the armor manually.

## Implementation by variant

Each section below describes the implementation of dragon-scaled armor in particular variants.

### NetHack Fourk

In NetHack Fourk, dragon scales provide no benefit to [AC](/wiki/AC "AC"), only granting their color's extrinsics and being used to create scaled armor. The armor-scaling process always [uncurses](/wiki/Uncurse "Uncurse") the body armor and makes it [erosion](/wiki/Erosion "Erosion")-proofed, and a blessed scroll additionally [blesses](/wiki/Bless "Bless") the armor and fixes any existing erosion.

Most colors of dragon scales and dragon-scaled armor confer two properties instead of one:

| Color  | Extrinsics                                                                                                                                              |
| ------ | ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- |
| Black  | [disintegration resistance](/wiki/Disintegration_resistance "Disintegration resistance"), [drain resistance](/wiki/Drain_resistance "Drain resistance") |
| Blue   | [shock resistance](/wiki/Shock_resistance "Shock resistance"), [automatic searching](/wiki/Automatic_searching "Automatic searching")                   |
| Gray   | [magic resistance](/wiki/Magic_resistance "Magic resistance")                                                                                           |
| Green  | [poison resistance](/wiki/Poison_resistance "Poison resistance"), [sickness resistance](/wiki/Sickness_resistance "Sickness resistance")                |
| Orange | [sleep resistance](/wiki/Sleep_resistance "Sleep resistance"), [free action](/wiki/Free_action "Free action")                                           |
| Red    | [fire resistance](/wiki/Fire_resistance "Fire resistance"), [infravision](/wiki/Infravision "Infravision")                                              |
| Silver | [reflection](/wiki/Reflection "Reflection")                                                                                                             |
| White  | [cold resistance](/wiki/Cold_resistance "Cold resistance"), inventory protection from [water damage](/wiki/Water_damage "Water damage")                 |
| Yellow | [acid resistance](/wiki/Acid_resistance "Acid resistance"), [stoning resistance](/wiki/Stoning_resistance "Stoning resistance")                         |

Red and white dragon scales and scaled armor also grant a fire or cold [breath weapon](/wiki/Breath_weapon "Breath weapon") respectively, which is accessible the [#monster](/wiki/Monster_\(command\) "Monster (command)") [extended command](/wiki/Extended_command "Extended command"); this breath weapon is overridden if the player is polymorphed into another [monster](/wiki/Monster "Monster") with a special ability.

### xNetHack

Dragon scales in xNetHack convey their extrinsic(s), 3 base AC, and no [MC](/wiki/MC "MC") - melding the scales to a set of armor adds the scales' 3 AC to it along with the extrinsics. A blessed scroll blesses the resulting armor and repairs all erosion, but the process never makes the armor erodeproof. A non-cursed scroll retains the original body armor's [enchantment](/wiki/Enchantment "Enchantment"), while a cursed scroll will subtract one point of enchantment and curse the armor. Reading the scroll while confused will polymorph the [hero](/wiki/Hero "Hero") into the relevant color dragon, regardless of any worn body armor.

xNetHack inherits [gold dragons](/wiki/Gold_dragon "Gold dragon") and their [scales](/wiki/Gold_dragon_scales "Gold dragon scales") from [NetHack 3.7.0](/wiki/NetHack_3.7.0 "NetHack 3.7.0"), as well as the secondary extrinsics that most dragon scales and dragon-scaled armor convey:

| Color  | Extrinsics                                                                                                                               |
| ------ | ---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- |
| Black  | disintegration resistance, drain resistance                                                                                              |
| Blue   | shock resistance, [very fast](/wiki/Very_fast "Very fast") speed                                                                         |
| Gold   | [light source](/wiki/Light_source "Light source"), [hallucination resistance](/wiki/Hallucination_resistance "Hallucination resistance") |
| Gray   | magic resistance                                                                                                                         |
| Green  | poison resistance, sickness resistance                                                                                                   |
| Orange | sleep resistance, free action                                                                                                            |
| Red    | fire resistance, infravision                                                                                                             |
| Silver | reflection                                                                                                                               |
| White  | cold resistance, [slow digestion](/wiki/Slow_digestion "Slow digestion")                                                                 |
| Yellow | acid resistance, stoning resistance                                                                                                      |

### EvilHack

EvilHack largely draws its implementation from xNetHack, with some minor adjustments. Dragon scales still grant 3 base AC, but melding them to a set of armor adds 5 AC to the armor. Wearing dragon scales only confers that color's primary extrinsic as in vanilla *[NetHack](/wiki/NetHack "NetHack")* (specifically [NetHack 3.6.7](/wiki/NetHack_3.6.7 "NetHack 3.6.7")), and the secondary extrinsics are only granted by the same color of dragon-scaled armor. Wishing for dragon scale mail of any color will give the hero a set of dragon scales of the same color, instead of completely failing.

EvilHack adds [shimmering](/index.php?title=Shimmering_dragon_\(EvilHack\)\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "Shimmering dragon (EvilHack) (page does not exist)"), [sea](/index.php?title=Sea_dragon_\(EvilHack\)\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "Sea dragon (EvilHack) (page does not exist)"), [celestial](/index.php?title=Celestial_dragon\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "Celestial dragon (page does not exist)"), and [shadow dragons](/index.php?title=Shadow_dragon\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "Shadow dragon (page does not exist)") along with their respective scales, and adds [chromatic dragon scales](/wiki/Chromatic_dragon_scales_\(EvilHack\) "Chromatic dragon scales (EvilHack)") that are only obtainable by killing [Tiamat](/wiki/Chromatic_Dragon#EvilHack "Chromatic Dragon").

EvilHack also makes a number of changes to the secondary effects that dragon-scaled armor offers compared to xNetHack, including giving several colors a [passive attack](/wiki/Passive_attack "Passive attack") that triggers when the wearer is attacked:

| Color      | Primary extrinsic                                                                                                        | Secondary effects (dragon-scaled armor)                                                                 |
| ---------- | ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------ | ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- |
| Black      | disintegration resistance                                                                                                | passive [disintegration](/wiki/Disintegration "Disintegration") attack                                  |
| Blue       | shock resistance                                                                                                         | confers speed, prevents slowing                                                                         |
| Celestial  | [flying](/wiki/Flying "Flying")                                                                                          | confers sleep, shock, and [sonic](/wiki/Sonic "Sonic") resistance                                       |
| Gold       | light source                                                                                                             | confers infravision and [clairvoyance](/wiki/Clairvoyance "Clairvoyance")                               |
| Gray       | magic resistance                                                                                                         | passive [cancellation](/wiki/Cancellation "Cancellation") attack, 90% chance of cancellation protection |
| Green      | poison resistance                                                                                                        | confers sickness resistance, passive [poison](/wiki/Poison "Poison") attack                             |
| Orange     | sleep resistance                                                                                                         | confers free action, passive [slow](/wiki/Slow "Slow") attack                                           |
| Red        | fire resistance                                                                                                          | +1d6 to all melee damage, passive [fire](/wiki/Fire "Fire") attack                                      |
| Sea        | [breathlessness](/wiki/Breathless "Breathless")                                                                          | confers the ability to [swim](/wiki/Swim "Swim")                                                        |
| Shadow     | [ultravision](/index.php?title=Ultravision\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "Ultravision (page does not exist)"), darkness source | confers sleep and drain resistance                                                                      |
| Shimmering | [displacement](/wiki/Displacement "Displacement")                                                                        | confers [stun](/wiki/Stun "Stun") resistance                                                            |
| Silver     | reflection                                                                                                               | confers cold resistance                                                                                 |
| White      | cold resistance                                                                                                          | freezes water and lava under foot, passive [cold](/wiki/Cold "Cold") attack                             |
| Yellow     | acid resistance                                                                                                          | confers stoning resistance, passive [acid](/wiki/Acid "Acid") attack                                    |
| Chromatic  | magic resistance, light source                                                                                           | special (see below)                                                                                     |

When chromatic dragon scales are used to make dragon-scaled armor, the armor gains reflection and resistances to fire, cold, shock, sleep, poison, disintegration, acid, stoning, and cancellation, while still retaining magic resistance and emitting light as the dragon scales do.

### Hack'EM

Hack'EM inherits the same creation details as EvilHack, including the secondary extrinsics and passive attacks only being available on dragon-scaled armor. [Robes](/wiki/Robe_\(SLASH%27EM\) "Robe (SLASH'EM)") are treated as body armor in Hack'EM, making dragon-scaled robes a viable armor choice for [Monks](/wiki/Monk "Monk") and [spellcasting](/wiki/Spellcasting "Spellcasting")-focused characters.

Hack'EM uses a different lineup of extrinsic properties for dragon scales and dragon-scaled armor compared to EvilHack, and also expands on the variant's passive attacks by giving one to every color of armor.

| Color      | Primary                   | Secondary                            | Passive attack                                                                       |
| ---------- | ------------------------- | ------------------------------------ | ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------ |
| Black      | Disintegration resistance | *(none)*                             | Disintegration (!!)                                                                  |
| Blue       | Shock resistance          | Speed                                | [Shocking](/wiki/Shock "Shock") (!!)                                                 |
| Deep       | Drain resistance          | Slow digestion                       | [Drain life](/wiki/Drain_life "Drain life")                                          |
| Gold       | Emits light               | Infravision, clairvoyance            | Blinding                                                                             |
| Gray       | Magic resistance          | Cancellation protection              | Cancellation (!!)                                                                    |
| Green      | Poison resistance         | Sickness resistance                  | Poison                                                                               |
| Orange     | Sleep resistance          | Free action                          | Slowing                                                                              |
| Red        | Fire resistance           | +1d6 melee damage                    | Fire (!!)                                                                            |
| Sea        | Magical breathing         | Swimming                             | Water/rust (!!)                                                                      |
| Shimmering | Displacement              | Stun resistance                      | Confusion/stunning/slowing                                                           |
| Silver     | Reflection                | Cold resistance, blinding resistance | [Mirror](/wiki/Mirror "Mirror") (only triggers 1⁄5 of the time on non-special cases) |
| Violet     | Sonic resistance          | Flying                               | Sonic (!!)                                                                           |
| White      | Cold resistance           | Freeze water, walk on lava           | Cold (!!)                                                                            |
| Yellow     | Acid resistance           | Stoning resistance                   | Acid (!!)                                                                            |

Passive attacks marked with a (!!) can destroy items held by the attacking monster or player if they hit (e.g. the passive white dragon-scaled armor can shatter [potions](/wiki/Potion "Potion")), which may hamper their utility in melee combat. However, most passive attacks only trigger around 1⁄3 (33%) of the time.

Black dragon-scaled armor will always hit, and has a 1⁄12 chance to disintegrate a weapon attacking the player (including gloves on unarmed/claw/touch attacks and boots on kicking attacks); if the weapon is not disintegrated, the attack then has a 1⁄40 chance to instantly disintegrate the monster. If neither happens, it will just "partially disintegrate" the monster as a regular physical attack.

Gray dragon-scaled armor has a 1⁄6 chance to hit with its cancelling attack, with the usual odds to cancel items.

Red dragon-scaled armor has a 1⁄2 chance to attempt to burn inventory items if the monster's inventory is not protected from fire damage; if this check succeeds, there are independent 1⁄3 chances to try to burn a scroll and a potion, and a 1⁄5 chance to try to burn a spellbook. The monster's weapon has a separate 2⁄3 chance of being burned since it's being held outside of the inventory. This all occurs separately of whether the passive attack hits the monster for HP damage.

Sea dragon-scaled armor will always hit with its wet attack, with the usual odds for rusting items.

White dragon-scaled armor has a 1⁄3 chance to attempt to shatter potions, independent of whether the attack hits the monster for HP damage.

[![This article describes a 3.4.3-based variant of NetHack. Click here for more information.](/images/5/5d/Nh343var-icon.png)](/wiki/NetHackWiki:Next_version "This article describes a 3.4.3-based variant of NetHack. Click here for more information.")

Dragon-scaled armor

From NetHackWiki
Jump to navigation Jump to search

Dragon-scaled armor is a set of items originally proposed by dtsund and designed as a replacement and re-balancing of dragon scale mail. Occasionally known as dtsund-DSM, various forms of dragon-scaled armor have appeared in several variants of NetHack: The proposal was first implemented into NetHack Fourk, and has seen further usage in xNetHack, EvilHack, and Hack'EM, each with varying minor details about how the new process works. All four variants add secondary effects to most or all colors of dragon-scaled armor, which are also documented here.

Contents

  • 1 Description
  • 2 Implementation by variant
    • 2.1 NetHack Fourk
    • 2.2 xNetHack
    • 2.3 EvilHack
    • 2.4 Hack'EM

Description

Across all variants, dragon scales occupy the cloak slot rather than the body armor slot, and reading a scroll of enchant armor will always cause worn dragon scales to meld into the hero's currently-worn set of body armor, adding the conferred extrinsic properties of the dragon scales to that armor. If the hero is wearing dragon scales but no body armor, the dragon scales will instead meld into their skin, polymorphing them into a dragon of the same color - as in NetHack, the scales are preserved upon the hero returning to normal form.

Directly wishing for dragon-scaled armor does not work, requiring the player to craft the armor manually.

Implementation by variant

Each section below describes the implementation of dragon-scaled armor in particular variants.

NetHack Fourk

In NetHack Fourk, dragon scales provide no benefit to AC, only granting their color's extrinsics and being used to create scaled armor. The armor-scaling process always uncurses the body armor and makes it erosion-proofed, and a blessed scroll additionally blesses the armor and fixes any existing erosion.

Most colors of dragon scales and dragon-scaled armor confer two properties instead of one:

Color Extrinsics
Black disintegration resistance, drain resistance
Blue shock resistance, automatic searching
Gray magic resistance
Green poison resistance, sickness resistance
Orange sleep resistance, free action
Red fire resistance, infravision
Silver reflection
White cold resistance, inventory protection from water damage
Yellow acid resistance, stoning resistance

Red and white dragon scales and scaled armor also grant a fire or cold breath weapon respectively, which is accessible the #monster extended command; this breath weapon is overridden if the player is polymorphed into another monster with a special ability.

xNetHack

Dragon scales in xNetHack convey their extrinsic(s), 3 base AC, and no MC - melding the scales to a set of armor adds the scales' 3 AC to it along with the extrinsics. xNetHack inherits gold dragons and their scales from NetHack 3.7.0, as well as the secondary extrinsics that most dragon scales and dragon-scaled armor convey:

Color Extrinsics
Black disintegration resistance, drain resistance
Blue shock resistance, very fast speed
Gold light source, hallucination resistance
Gray magic resistance
Green poison resistance, sickness resistance
Orange sleep resistance, free action
Red fire resistance, infravision
Silver reflection
White cold resistance, slow digestion
Yellow acid resistance, stoning resistance

EvilHack

EvilHack largely draws its implementation from xNetHack, with some minor adjustments. Dragon scales still grant 3 base AC, but melding them to a set of armor adds 5 AC to the armor. EvilHack adds shimmering, sea, celestial, and shadow dragons along with their respective scales, and adds chromatic dragon scales that are only obtainable by killing Tiamat.

EvilHack also makes a number of changes to the secondary effects that dragon-scaled armor offers compared to xNetHack, including giving several colors a passive attack that triggers when the wearer is attacked:

Color Primary extrinsic Secondary effects (dragon-scaled armor)
Black disintegration resistance passive disintegration attack
Blue shock resistance confers speed, prevents slowing
Celestial flying confers sleep, shock, and sonic resistance
Gold light source confers infravision and clairvoyance
Gray magic resistance passive cancellation attack, 90% chance of cancellation protection
Green poison resistance confers sickness resistance, passive poison attack
Orange sleep resistance confers free action, passive slow attack
Red fire resistance +1d6 to all melee damage, passive fire attack
Sea breathlessness confers the ability to swim
Shadow ultravision, darkness source confers sleep and drain resistance
Shimmering displacement confers stun resistance
Silver reflection confers cold resistance
White cold resistance freezes water and lava under foot, passive cold attack
Yellow acid resistance confers stoning resistance, passive acid attack

Color Primary Secondary Passive attack
Black Disintegration resistance (none) Disintegration (!!)
Blue Shock resistance Speed Shocking (!!)
Deep Drain resistance Slow digestion Drain life
Gold Emits light Infravision, clairvoyance Blinding
Gray Magic resistance Cancellation protection Cancellation (!!)
Green Poison resistance Sickness resistance Poison
Orange Sleep resistance Free action Slowing
Red Fire resistance +1d6 melee damage Fire (!!)
Sea Magical breathing Swimming Water/rust (!!)
Shimmering Displacement Stun resistance Confusion/stunning/slowing
Silver Reflection Cold resistance, blinding resistance Mirror (only triggers 1⁄5 of the time on non-special cases)
Violet Sonic resistance Flying Sonic (!!)
White Cold resistance Freeze water, walk on lava Cold (!!)
Yellow Acid resistance Stoning resistance Acid (!!)

This all occurs separately of whether the passive attack hits the monster for HP damage.

Sea dragon-scaled armor will always hit with its wet attack, with the usual odds for rusting items.

When chromatic dragon scales are used to make dragon-scaled armor, the armor gains reflection and resistances to fire, cold, shock, sleep, poison, disintegration, acid, stoning, and cancellation, while still retaining magic resistance and emitting light as the dragon scales do.

===Hack'EM===
Hack'EM inherits the same creation details as EvilHack, including the secondary extrinsics and passive attacks only being available on dragon-scaled armor. [[Robe (SLASH'EM)|Robes]] are treated as body armor in Hack'EM, making dragon-scaled robes a viable armor choice for [[Monk]]s and [[spellcasting]]-focused characters.

Hack'EM uses a different lineup of extrinsic properties for dragon scales and dragon-scaled armor compared to EvilHack, and also expands on the variant's passive attacks by giving one to every color of armor.

Passive attacks marked with a (!!) can destroy items held by the attacking monster or player if they hit (e.g. the passive white dragon-scaled armor can shatter [[potion]]s), which may hamper their utility in melee combat. However, most passive attacks only trigger around {{frac|3}} (33%) of the time.

<!-- these are all based on mhitu.c, haven't checked uhitm.c to see if it's symmetrical between players and monsters or not -->
Black dragon-scaled armor will always hit, and has a {{frac|12}} chance to disintegrate a weapon attacking the player (including gloves on unarmed/claw/touch attacks and boots on kicking attacks); if the weapon is not disintegrated, the attack then has a {{frac|40}} chance to instantly disintegrate the monster. If neither happens, it will just "partially disintegrate" the monster as a regular physical attack.

Gray dragon-scaled armor has a {{frac|6}} chance to hit with its cancelling attack, with the usual odds to cancel items.

Red dragon-scaled armor has a {{frac|2}} chance to attempt to burn inventory items if the monster's inventory is not protected from fire damage; if this check succeeds, there are independent {{frac|3}} chances to try to burn a scroll and a potion, and a {{frac|5}} chance to try to burn a spellbook. The monster's weapon has a separate {{frac|2|3}} chance of being burned since it's being held outside of the inventory. This all occurs separately of whether the passive attack hits the monster for HP damage.

Sea dragon-scaled armor will always hit with its wet attack, with the usual odds for rusting items.

White dragon-scaled armor has a {{frac|3}} chance to attempt to shatter potions, independent of whether the attack hits the monster for HP damage.
